results.title: Circulation and the human body
results.brief_description: Uses animation to explain the needs of the body’s cells and how some of these needs are serviced by the circulation system. It details how blood returns from the capillaries to the heart through the venous system, and how the chambers of the heart pump the blood through the pulmonary circulation, then back through the arterial system to the capillaries.

results.title: A Circle of love
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A group of college students get together in a “circle of love”, ie an “encounter group” to improve interpersonal relationships. Comprises highlights from several sessions in which six students, who have never met before, react to taped instructions from a behavioural research institute. Participants learn to express their real feelings about themselves and their fellow students, and learn to overcome anxieties and shyness in the presence of others. Reporter: Walter Cronkite
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman, CBS News and West Coast Productions

results.title: A Circle is determined by three points
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Geometry”.
The three degrees of freedom of a circle - the radius and the co-ordinates of the centre - are reduced stage by stage until finally three points are given. Animated diagrams.

results.title: Circles II
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase, King Screen Productions and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Members of the Mary Stanton Dance Ensemble perform in and around huge fibreglass circles designed by artist/filmmaker Doris Chase. A superimposition technique is used on the circles and human forms, which rotate in a of different patterns and colors. The dancers move with, around and through the kinetic sculptures. Music by George Kleinsinger. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Doris Chase, King Screen Productions and Perspective Films

results.title: Cipher in the snow
results.creator_credit: Keith J. Atkinson, Wetzel O. Whitaker and Brigham Young University
results.brief_description: A child asks to be let off the school bus - and dies in the snow. Neither students nor teachers know him - his favourite teacher, who barely remembers him - goes to see his parents. In an attempt to write an obituary the teacher reads through the child’s school reports. The people around him changed him into a nobody. Designed for teachers to motivate a concern for the needs of every child.

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Afghanistan, “Switzerland of Asia”, has about twelve million inhabitants and twelve cinemas. To one of these cinemas, the admission is one afghani. (Accorded the Award of Merit, Oberhausen).

results.brief_description: Shows how a performance of the puppet-show Cinderella is prepared, how the puppets are made and operated, and finally presents a complete performance of the story.

results.title: Cinder in your eye
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: An atmospheric and poetic treatment of the restoration of railway engines accompanied by the natural sounds and music of the banjo and harmonica. Locomotives and historic rolling stock once again reign in Tasmania’s superb countryside in this journey into nostalgia.
